au.edu.jcu.v4l4j
Class JPEGFrameGrabber

java.lang.Object
  au.edu.jcu.v4l4j.JPEGFrameGrabber
All Implemented Interfaces:
FrameGrabber
public class JPEGFrameGrabber
extends java.lang.Object

Objects of this class are used to retrieve JPEG-encoded frames from a VideoDevice. A JPEG frame grabber can only be created if the associated video device can produce images in a format v4l4j knows how to encode in JPEG. The VideoDevice.supportJPEGConversion() method can be used to find out whether a video device can have its images JPEG-encoded by v4l4j, ie if a JPEG frame grabber can be instantiated. JPEGFrameGrabber objects are not instantiated directly. Instead, the VideoDevice.getJPEGFrameGrabber(int, int, int, int, int) or VideoDevice.getJPEGFrameGrabber(int, int, int, int, int, ImageFormat) method must be called on the associated VideoDevice. Requested height and width may be adjusted to the closest supported values. The adjusted width and height can be retrieved by calling getWidth() and getHeight().
A typical JPEGFrameGrabber use is as follows:

//create a new video device
VideoDevice vd = new VideoDevice("/dev/video0");

//Create an instance of FrameGrabber
FrameGrabber f = vd.getJPEGFrameGrabber(320, 240, 0, 0, 80);

//Start the frame capture
f.startCapture();
while (!stop) {
   ByteBuffer b= f.getFrame(); //Get a frame
   //frame size is b.limit()
   //do something useful with b
}

//Stop the capture
f.stopCapture();

//Free capture resources and release the FrameGrabber
vd.releaseFrameGrabber();

//release VideoDevice
vd.release();

Once the frame grabber is released with VideoDevice.releaseFrameGrabber(), it can NOT be re-initialised again , and a new one must be obtained. However, when the capture is stopped with stopCapture(), it can be started again with startCapture() without having to create a new FrameGrabber.

Author:
gilles
See Also:

setJPGQuality

public void setJPGQuality(int q)
This method sets the desired JPEG quality.

Parameters:
q - the quality (between V4L4JConstants.MIN_JPEG_QUALITY and V4L4JConstants.MAX_JPEG_QUALITY inclusive)
Throws:
StateException - if this FrameGrabber has been already released, and therefore must not be used anymore.

getImageFormat

public ImageFormat getImageFormat()
This method returns the native image format used by this FrameGrabber. The returned format specifies the image format the capture uses, ie the one images are retrieved from the device BEFORE JPEG conversion.

Returns:
the native image format used by this FrameGrabber.
Throws:
StateException - if this FrameGrabber has been already released, and therefore must not be used anymore.

setFrameInterval

public void setFrameInterval(int num,
                             int denom)
                      throws InvalidValue
Description copied from interface: FrameGrabber
This method sets the frame interval used for capture. The frame interval defined the lapse of time (in second) between two captured frames and is the inverse of the frame rate. It may or may not be supported by the underlying hardware/driver. If not supported, calling this method throws a UnsupportedMethod exception. This method will throw an InvalidValue exception if the given frame interval value is not supported. As a guide, you can check the ResolutionInfo objects associated with the video device to find out whether frame intervals are at all supported, and if they are, what values (or range of values) is accepted. ResolutionInfo objects can be obtained for each ImageFormat. See the ImageFormat and ResolutionInfo documentation for more information.

Specified by:
setFrameInterval in interface FrameGrabber
Parameters:
num - the numerator of the frame interval to be set
denom - the denominator of the frame interval to be set
Throws:
InvalidValue - if the given frame interval value is invalid.

getFrameInterval

public FrameInterval.DiscreteInterval getFrameInterval()
Description copied from interface: FrameGrabber
This method returns the current frame interval used for capture. It may or may not be supported by the underlying hardware/driver. If not supported, calling this method throws a UnsupportedMethod exception.

Specified by:

getFrame

public final java.nio.ByteBuffer getFrame()
                                   throws V4L4JException
Description copied from interface: FrameGrabber
This method retrieves one frame from the video source. The ByteBuffer limit() is set to the size of the captured frame. Note that the returned ByteBuffer is not backed by an array. This is a JNI limitation (not v4l4j).

Specified by:
getFrame in interface FrameGrabber
Returns:
a ByteBuffer containing frame data.
Throws:
V4L4JException - if there is an error capturing from the source.
